title: Bug in AdaptiveCodeResolver
body:
**Describe the bug**
Adding a new network protocol during open session can break the connection.

When we add new network protocol, new AdaptiveCodeResolver is created:
https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/blob/master/src/Nethermind/Nethermind.Network/P2P/Session.cs#L538-L564

It is used to calculate AdaptiveId when sending message:
https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/blob/master/src/Nethermind/Nethermind.Network/P2P/Session.cs#L232
https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/blob/master/src/Nethermind/Nethermind.Network/P2P/Session.cs#L609-L628

And to recognize protocols of incoming messages:
https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/blob/master/src/Nethermind/Nethermind.Network/P2P/Session.cs#L254-L256
https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/blob/master/src/Nethermind/Nethermind.Network/P2P/Session.cs#L592-L607

In constructor of AdaptiveCodeResolver, P2P protocol is hardcoded to be on first position (_alphabetically[0]) and other protocols are sorted alphabetically:
https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/blob/master/src/Nethermind/Nethermind.Network/P2P/Session.cs#L580-L590

On current master we have enabled P2P and Eth protocols + optionally Wit. So we have:
_alphabetically[0] = P2P (with MessageIdSpaceSize = 16)
_alphabetically[1] = Eth (with MessageIdSpaceSize = 17)
_alphabetically[2] = Wit (optionally, with MessageIdSpaceSize = 3)

Sending/receiving P2P messages have AdaptiveId 0-15, Eth 16-32 and Wit 33-35
And it works fine.

When working on Account Abstraction and its network protocol, I added AaProtocol with a code "aa" and it broke the connection.
Then:
_alphabetically[0] = P2P (with MessageIdSpaceSize = 16)
_alphabetically[1] = Aa (with MessageIdSpaceSize = 4)
_alphabetically[2] = Eth (with MessageIdSpaceSize = 17)
_alphabetically[3] = Wit (optionally, with MessageIdSpaceSize = 3)

So sending/receiving P2P messages should have AdaptiveId 0-15, Aa 16-19, Eth 20-36 and Wit 37-39

When Eth Status message is sent by node before initializing Aa protocol, has AdaptiveId 16. But if AaProtocol was initialized in the meantime, receiving node is receiving message with AdaptiveId = 16 and recognizing it as Aa message, and it causes lack of properly processed Eth Status message and leads to disconnect because of timeout.

**Expected behavior**
Adding new network protocol should not broke node's connection.

**Additional context**
I did some hacky fix on account-abstraction branch. I hardcoded Eth protocol to always be on second position (_alphabetically[1]):
https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/blob/account-abstraction/src/Nethermind/Nethermind.Network/P2P/Session.cs#L580-L599

It solves a problem for that particular use-case, but is not fixing this issue as a whole.
Please confirm with Felix Lange @fjl or Peter Szilagyi @karalabe if they have any specific rules for satellite protocols.

Unsure what "if AaProtocol was initialized in the meantime" means. The protocols are negotiated during devp2p handshake and cannot be extended later on a connection. You can advertise as many or as few protocols as you want with multiple versions too, but the number mappings are decided during handshake.
